meanings.definition: A compound that plays a crucial role in the production of energy by transporting fatty acids into your cells' mitochondria.
meanings.sent1: Carnitine helps move fatty acids to your cells' energy factories.
meanings.sent2: I take a supplement with carnitine to boost my energy levels.
meanings.sent3: The fatty acids were so lazy until carnitine came along to give them a ride.
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny ferry, carnitine carries fatty acids across the cell's energy river.
meanings.sent5: Imagine carnitine as a tiny energy taxi for fatty acids.

meanings.definition: A substance found in certain foods, such as meat and dairy products, or taken as a dietary supplement.
meanings.sent1: Meat and dairy products contain carnitine for energy production.
meanings.sent2: I prefer getting my carnitine from natural sources like meat.
meanings.sent3: The steak was so full of carnitine, it practically walked itself to the grill.
meanings.sent4: Her smoothie was a blend of health, with a dash of carnitine for good measure.
meanings.sent5: The dairy aisle was a treasure trove of carnitine-rich foods.
